questions.question: Question 1: Which of the following was the world’s first international health agency?

options.c: Health Organization of the League of Nations
options.d: United States Agency for International Development

questions.explanation:
The first international health agency to be established was the Pan American Sanitary 
Bureau (PASB) in 1š02. This was followed by the establishment of the Health Organization of the League of Nations in 
1š2‰. The World Health Organisation (WHO) was established on ˜th April 1š‹™.

questions.question: Question 3: What was the theme for World Health Day 202‰?
questions.explanation:
The theme for World Health Day 202‰ was Health for all. World Health Day is celebrated on ˜th April and each year a different theme is adopted such as: • 202‹- My health, my right • 2022- Our planet, our health • 2021- Build a fairer, healthier world for everyone, everywhere • 2020 - Support nurses and midwives • 201™ & 201š - Universal health coverage: everyone, everywhere • 201˜ - Depression: Let’s talk • 2016 - Beat diabetes • 2015 - Food safety Health days

questions.question: Question 4: When is World No Tobacco Day observed?
questions.explanation:
World No Tobacco Day is observed on ‰1st May. The theme of World No Tobacco Day 2021 is 'commit to Žuit'. It conveys that the COVID-1š 
pandemic has led to millions of tobacco users saying they want to Žuit. The theme of World No Tobacco Day 2020 was #TobaccoExposed. It aimed to provide a 
counter-marketing campaign that shows smokers have a higher risk of getting a severe case of 
COVID-1š and to empower young people to engage in the fight against tobacco. 775 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 5: What was the theme of World TB Day 202‰?

options.c: Invest to End TB. Save Lives

questions.explanation: The theme of world TB day 202‰ was 'Yes! We can end TB!'. World Tuberculosis Day is observed on 2‹th March of every year. The themes for the other world TB days are: The theme of 202‹ continues to be, 'Yes! We can end TB!' 2022: Invest to End TB. Save Lives 2021: The clock is ticking 2020: It's time to End TB 201š: It’s time for action 201™: Wanted: Leaders for a TB-free world

questions.question: Question 6: Where is the headŽuarters of the WHO located?
questions.explanation:
The headŽuarters of the WHO is in Geneva, Switzerland. The WHO is a specialized, non-political health agency of the United Nations. It came into force on 
˜th April 1š‹™. Its objective is the attainment of the highest level of health by all people. The structure of the 
WHO includes: • The World Health Assembly • The Executive Board • The Secretariat Important headŽuarters of international organisations include: • The headŽuarters of UNICEF and UNDP is in New York, USA. • Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) headŽuarters is in Rome, Italy. • HeadŽuarters of the International Labor Organization (ILO) and the International Red Cross are 
also in Geneva. The image below shows the WHO emblem. 776 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 7: Which of the following is not one of the duties of the WHO?
questions.explanation: State health is not one of the duties of the WHO. It is the responsibility of the government. Work and duties of the WHO: • Prevention and control of specific diseases • Development of comprehensive health services • Family health • Environmental health • Health statistics • Biomedical research • Health literature and information • Cooperation with other organizations

questions.question: Question 8: Where is the South East Asian Regional Office of the WHO located?
questions.explanation:
The South-East Asian Regional Office (SEARO) of the WHO is located in New Delhi. Duties of the 
SEARO include planning for malaria eradication, tuberculosis control, and rural health services. Members of SEARO are: • Bangladesh • India • Bhutan • Indonesia 777 
Sold by @itachibot • Democratic People’s Republic of Korea • The Republic of Maldives • Myanmar • Nepal • Sri Lanka • Thailand • Timor-Leste The regional offices of the WHO are listed below. Regional office

questions.question: Question 9: What is the surveillance reporting system used by the WHO?
questions.explanation:
The surveillance reporting system used by the WHO is the Weekly Epidemiological Record 
(WER). The WHO collects and disseminates epidemiological information on diseases subject to 
International Health Regulations. It is done through an Automatic Telex Reply Service (ATRS) 
and the Weekly Epidemiological Record (WER).

questions.question:
Question 10: As a part of the ‘Clean care is safer care’ campaign, you have been asked to give a presentation 
to the nurses in the obstetrics and gynecology department. Which of the following areas is 
targeted in this campaign?
questions.explanation:
‘Clean care is safer care’ campaign was started by the WHO to improve hand hygiene practices. In 2005, WHO developed this campaign aimed at the reduction of healthcare-associated 
infections (HCAI) through the worldwide promotion of appropriate hand hygiene practices.

questions.question:
Question 11: Which agency of the United Nations has the given logo? 768 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
778 
Sold by @itachibot The given logo is that of the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF). It works closely with the 
WHO on health matters. UNICEF’s content of services include: • Child health • Child nutrition • Family and child welfare • Formal and informal education UNICEF participates in urban basic services (UBS) with the aim to promote access to basic 
services like nutrition, water supply, and sanitation. UNICEF started the Baby-Friendly Hospital Initiative (BFHI) to promote breastfeeding and 
improve maternal and child care. In 2016, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare launched 
the Mothers Absolute Affection (MAA) programme to revitalize efforts towards protection, 
promotion and support of breastfeeding practices.

questions.question: Question 12: Which of the following are components of UNICEF’s GOBI FFF strategy?
questions.explanation:
The components of the GOBI FFF strategy by the UNICEF are: • Growth monitoring with growth charts • Oral rehydration therapy for diarrhoea and dehydration • Breastfeeding • Immunization of children • Family planning and birth spacing • Food supplementation • Female literacy promotion The GOBI FFF strategy is aimed at revolutionising child health and survival. Initially, it was called 
GOBI strategy and later the FFF aspect was added to it.

questions.question:
Question 13: Which agency of the UN gives funds for technical assistance and has the following as part of 
its logo?
questions.explanation:
United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is an agency of the UN that gives funds for 
technical assistance. It has the following logo. 779 
Sold by @itachibot Its main objective is to help poorer nations develop their human and natural resources to their 
potential. Some other agencies of the UN include: • UNESCO - United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization • UNEP - United Nations Environment Programme • UNHCR - United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees Their logos are given below. 780 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 14: Which organisation gives the highest funding for reproductive health?
questions.explanation:
United Nations Fund for Population Activities (UNFPA) gives the highest funding for reproductive 
health. It works in the area of health and family welfare. It mainly works by: • Developing the national capability in manufacturing contraceptives, • Promoting population education programmes • Introducing innovative approaches to family planning and MCH care. Sexual and Reproductive Health Awareness Day is organized on February 12th every year to raise 
awareness about sexual and reproductive health. The logo of the UNFPA is given below. 781 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 15: Which of the following is not an objective of the FAO?

options.a: To better the condition of rural people
options.b: Improve nutrition of people of all countries

questions.explanation:
Improving access to nutritious foods is not one of the objectives of the FAO. Aims of the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO): • To help nations raise living standards • To improve the nutrition of people of all countries • To increase the efficiency of farming, forestry, and fisheries • To better the condition of rural people The FAO organized a Freedom from Hunger Campaign (FFHC) in 1š60. Its main objective was to 
combat malnutrition and to disseminate information and education. The FAO logo is given below. 782 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 16: Which agency of the United Nations has the following logo?

options.c: United States Agency for International Development

questions.explanation:
The given logo is of the World Bank. It helps less developed countries raise their living standards with economic support. The 
allocation of funds is decided by its Board of Governors.

questions.question: Question 17: What does the branch of medicine known as nosology deal with?
questions.explanation: Nosology is the branch of medicine that deals with the classification of diseases.

questions.question: Question 18: Study of which of the following is known as emporiatrics?
questions.explanation:
Emporiatrics is the study of the health of travelers. It is also called travel medicine. It deals with the prevention and management of health problems 
of international travelers.

questions.question: Question 19: Quarantine measures were implemented for the first time to prevent the spread of:
questions.explanation:
Quarantine was introduced for the first time to prevent the spread of the plague, also known as 
the black death. Quarantine is the restriction on the movement of people, animals, and goods that may have been 
exposed to a communicable disease. It is intended to prevent the spread of communicable 
diseases. Quarantine is distinct from medical isolation, in which those confirmed to be infected with a 
communicable disease are isolated from the healthy population.

questions.question:
Question 20: Which of the following is not included in the Special Programme for Research and Training in 
Tropical Disease (TDR) strategy of the WHO?
questions.explanation:
Tick-borne encephalitis is not included in the Special Programme for Research and Training in 
Tropical Disease (TDR) strategy of the WHO. The diseases included under this programme are: • Chagas disease • Dengue • Ebola • Helminthiasis 783 
Sold by @itachibot • Leishmaniasis • Leprosy • Lymphatic filariasis • Malaria • Onchocerciasis • Schistosomiasis • Trypanosomiasis • Tuberculosis The programme is sponsored by the WHO, UNICEF, UNDP, and World Bank.

questions.question:
Question 21: According to the International Health Regulations, on diagnosing a patient with which of the 
following diseases is notification not mandatory in all countries?
questions.explanation:
According to the International Health Regulations(IHR), notification is not mandatory if a patient 
is diagnosed with tuberculosis in all countries. It needs to be notified only by the countries where the public health impact is serious and there is 
a risk of international spread. The government of India made the reporting of new cases of TB mandatory for all medical 
practitioners from 2012. An online web-based application named Nikshay is available for this 
purpose. Treatment providers are given a nominal cash incentive of Rs.1000/- per TB patient 
reported.

questions.question: Question 22: Which of the following disease is not under international surveillance by the WHO?
questions.explanation:
Chagas disease is not under international surveillance by the WHO. Surveillance is usually done for infectious diseases and diseases that have the potential to become 
epidemics or pandemics.

questions.question: Question 23: Patients with which of the following diseases do not reŽuire isolation or Žuarantine?
questions.explanation:
Patients with West Nile fever do not reŽuire isolation or Žuarantine. Isolation and Žuarantine are used for highly infectious diseases that are at risk of 
becoming epidemics or pandemics.

questions.question:
Question 24: You are asked to investigate a possible act of terrorism using anthrax. Which of the following 
is false regarding this category of bioterrorism agent?
questions.explanation:
784 
Sold by @itachibot Anthrax falls under category A of bioterrorism agents. These organisms are usually easy to 
disseminate. Category A refers to high priority agents. They have high case-fatality rates and high 
transmissibility. Thus, a specialised public health response is reŽuired to combat such attacks.

questions.question: Question 25: How many goals does the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) comprise of?
questions.explanation:
The Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) are comprised of 1˜ goals. These were set as part of the official Sustainable Development Goals of the Agenda 20‰0. These 
goals consist of a total of 16š targets. SDGs replaced the Millennium Development Goals on 1st 
†anuary 2016. The 20‰0 agenda consists of five P's: • People • Planet • Prosperity • Peace • Partnership 785 
Sold by @itachibot Descriptive Statistics I - Probability and Data
